prop.head.headtext: Practical Advice for Protecting Confidential Business Information

para.paratext: Documentation that demonstrates the level of actual responsibility held by an employee should be maintained in the employee's personnel file. This would include any letters, memoranda or minutes of meetings which discuss job responsibilities. Likewise, any documents which demonstrate the employee's ability to exercise some discretion or power, to unilaterally exercise power or discretion so as to have an impact on the employer's legal or practical interests, or any peculiar vulnerability of the employer should be maintained.[1]
LAC Minerals Ltd. v. International Corona Resources Ltd. (1989), 61 D.L.R. (4th) 14, [1989] 2 S.C.R. 574.
